Bus.cs.7152: Oooo... My feet hurt from all that shopping.$s#$b#Hey. Could you ask the driver how long it'll be until we get to Stardew?
Bus.cs.7156: Driver: Huh? We're almost there. It should only be a few more minutes.
Bus.cs.7157: Sir? Are you still there?$u#$b#Uh-huh... sorry to put you on hold, sir. I had some business to attend to.$h
Bus.cs.7158: That's right, sir... I'm on the bus right now, heading to Stardew Valley.$h
Bus.cs.7159: I have to say, so far I've been quite unimpressed with the locals.$h
Bus.cs.7160: They seem like a docile and unfashionable sort of people.$s#$b#The children look sickly, and all the young men are delinquents from what I've seen so far...$h
Bus.cs.7161: Although, they are displaying our corporate logo, which you'll be pleased to hear, sir.$h
Bus.cs.7162: *snort* ... Yes, sir. It definitely won't be a problem to get these country rubes to sign the paperwork...$u#$b#We'll have that new Joja Hypermarket up and running in no time. Then maybe we can discuss that new-$u

GrandpaStory.cs.12051: Dear {0},^^If you're reading this, you must be in dire need of a change.^^The same thing happened to me, long ago. I'd lost sight of what mattered most in life... real connections with other people and nature. So I dropped everything and moved to the place I truly belong.^^^I've enclosed the deed to that place... my pride and joy: {1} Farm. It's located in Stardew Valley, on the southern coast. It's the perfect place to start your new life.^^This was my most precious gift of all, and now it's yours. I know you'll honor the family name, my boy. Good luck.^^Love, Grandpa^^P.S. If Lewis is still alive say hi to the old guy for me, will ya?
